website_summaries.verdict: 14,000 BTU portable cooling system uses an antimicrobial filter to make your environment cool and clean.
pros: 3 modes include air conditioner, fan, and dehumidifier
Dehumidifier removes up to 91 pints of water per day
cons: Not quiet enough for some users
Operation struggles in higher outside temperatures

customer_reviews.title: I love this AC unit and I strongly recommend to have ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this AC unit and I strongly recommend to have one. Although heavy but easy to install. Cooled my room within 5 minutes and got freezing, but over all this is a great product for the summer indoors. It is not too noisy and the fan power is strong enough to freeze up to 600-800 sqf Perfect for my room and I love it !
customer_reviews.author: PeeGooJustin

customer_reviews.title: If you wanted to cool down you would have to stand right next to ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit is not the quietest and the vent does not oscillate automatically. The biggest problem was that in a 400sq ft room it could only drop the temperature about 2-4 degrees. This was even a bigger problem when I had more people in the room, it seemed to be just making noise. If you wanted to cool down you would have to stand right next to it. I live in San Diego and the out air temperature was approximately 80-84 degrees. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: J. Buttler

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use Unit-No Pre-Filter in Box-Customer Support will not call back or return emails
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as we are having a heat wave and I needed an air conditioner that would not bother my allergies (thus the filters on this unit). I received the unit on 7.3.18 and still I am not able to use it. The pre-filter that is a requirement to run the unit was not included in the box with the unit (page 11 of the manual states that you cannot run the model without the pre-filter in place). I called their customer service on 7.3.18 and sent an email to Customer Support. No call back yet and the return email from Customer Support said that I would hear back within 24-48 hours. No email back either.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor119

customer_reviews.title: It can maybe cool 300sf. So it works
customer_reviews.text: It rattles. It can maybe cool 300sf. So it works, but not even close to a regular A/C. I'd say for $500, if you can, get a window or wall A/C. We have it by the living room couch in Santa Monica. So a beach city. And it does OK for the living room. The dining room and hall are open to this room but they get almost zero benefit. So in your bedroom, it is pretty good. In your bedroom in Palm Springs during summer, I suspect it would barely make it or croak.
customer_reviews.author: Carie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Dont but this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 120 sq. ft. room. it was 80 degrees out side, all my windows are closed with the venting going outside. I also have black out curtains. it took all day to bring the temperature down to 78 degrees from 80 degrees. The air coming out of the unit I would say is around 65 degrees on the A/C mode. I bought this thinking something this expensive would be better than a cheaper model, I was wrong. I have a friend who bought a unit at home depot for $120 that is a thousand time better than this unit. --- DO NOT BUY THIS IS GARBAGE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Evans

customer_reviews.title: get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I spent the extra $50...this thing is perfect..........cooling my living room 30'X15' ,no problem...then the humidy feature is the real cats meeow...talk about comfortable air..Perfect for the northeast..........Glad I bought it.I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy
customer_reviews.text: Not vibration isolated well enough. Cooling power not as strong than I thought. Need to run it for two hours to get a normal sized bedroom cooled, while closing all doors. Impossible to sleep when running it, since too noisy. Buttons spaced to closely and not labeled well enough, so too easy to press the wrong button. Water builds up, and it has a tank at the bottom to capture the water, but tank is difficult to empty. You have to lift the entire unit up, which is pretty heavy, then tilt it, to pour the water out. They should have located the water tank and valve three inches higher. Who ever engineered it was not detail oriented.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: The dual hose setup is way more efficient and performs way better than the single hose unit I was using. Not having negative pressure, pulling hot air into the room cools the room off way faster, and keeps the room cooler. I do have a blower type fan on the other side of this unit to push air into the room better. I am using this in a large bedroom, (150 sq ft) and it keeps the room at the temp I set all night. I did notice my electric bill was lower with this unit, than with a single hose unit.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Installation was super easy.
customer_reviews.text: This beast is holding its own in our 1500 square foot illustration and photography studio, occupied by two people most days. I had worried I'd need to buy two to get the appropriate number of BTUs for our space, but it's already August in the hot/humid midwest and we're sitting comfy. Installation was super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Trouty

customer_reviews.title: Works wel.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as we have two full size central ac units for split zones but it was expensive even w solar to have one or the other on all night. So we bought this for the main bedroom. Cools it down quickly. The room is 400 square feet and the unit works fine. It isn’t super quiet but not overly noisy. Easy to get used to. We have it off during the day. At night the room is nice and chilled. Since it’s been 100 plus out here lately this has been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Berkowitz

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: There should be a zero star choice. I purchased this unit summer of 2018 and only used it a few times. Now just starting summer of 2019 without having used it, I plugged it in and it doesn't work. Even the few times it did work it still didn't do a very good job. We have a small living room that never did reach cooler than 80 degrees. Do not purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Debbi

customer_reviews.title: Keeps tripping the circuit breaker
customer_reviews.text: Great unit when it works. However, it keeps tripping the 15A circuit breaker. It supposed to draw 10.8 amps. Have had other portable A/C units on this circuit with no problems. Last night, the unit was the only item on and it still tripped the circuit breaker so am beginning to suspect the unit has electrical problems. Purchased it on April 5. Return window closed May 31. It is now June 26. Not happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Early Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for IT work areas
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: Self-evaporative "Auto drain" feature works as advertised, controllable from unit and/or remote, dual hose for better performance Con's: Not quite a strong as other PAC's, but balances out with functions that work as advertised. Comment's: One of the only manufacturers to offer a truly self contained PAC that operates as advertised. MFG communication and warranty services leave much to be desired, so make sure to get an extended warranty from place of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gaffer

customer_reviews.title: NOISY!!  And shoots cool air straight up.
customer_reviews.text: Had to tape a piece of cardboard onto vent to get cool air to flow out in any direction other than straight up. It is extremely noisy even when only on fan. And even louder when A/C is on. It does blow cool air but we cannot stand to leave it on all the time because the noise never stops. Fan runs ALL the time. Then extra noise when needs A/C to reduce temp.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye sweat!
customer_reviews.text: The California summers are getting longer and warmer. In places without central AC, this really gets the job done. We can cool our living room or turn a bedroom into an icebox with this. As expected, it is a bit loud. So you'll have to turn up the volume on your TV to hear over it. But once used to the whirring, it's not bothersome. Easy to control.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all... Refrigerate leaked out in shipping box... Returned Amazon was great about the return.. ended up purchasing an LG
customer_reviews.author: Stump

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t shut off when temp is reached. Called for support but amazon lady had no idea how to help. She just read the manual back to me. Might be a one off issue, but will def be returning
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This AC is pretty sweet I was hesitant to spend the money but it was a good purchase. Don't plan on any portable AC cooling more than a large room it isn't going to happen. This has worked for 2 summers so far without any issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: The product does a good job cooling my large bedroom, however it is loud. In order to sleep in a cooled room I set it to hi cool an hour before bed, and then switch it to low fan in order to actually sleep (low fan is quieter by comparison to hi cool).
customer_reviews.author: Miss C

customer_reviews.title: Makes a hot room less hot, but doesn’t make it cool.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to install. Looks nice. Easy to operate. Cons: Does not cool as much as advertised. Takes the edge off a hot day if you run it day and night, but does not really make the room cool. Noisy even at a low fan speed. So if that’s not a problem (like using in a bedroom at night to create white noise) great, but don’t try watching tv with it. You can install a heat pump for double the price and ten times more benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Parent force

customer_reviews.title: This unit does not shut off the compressor (cooling unit) ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit does not shut off the compressor (cooling unit) when the temperature reaches the setting I set. For example if I set it to 75 degrees it keeps cooling and the temp keeps going down to below 60 degrees. Basically you can either turn it on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Dont use in a garage
customer_reviews.text: My garage is insulated but this unit doesn't really cool down one of my 2 car garages. It does keep the garage from getting above 80 degrees though which is tolerable but not what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: My opinion

customer_reviews.title: Very humid
customer_reviews.text: Even the dehumidifier setting raises the humidity into the high 50% range. It is cold, but i need to run my dehumidifier to keep humidity healthy
customer_reviews.author: Psylent

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, does not work well
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well, I paid this much for what performs like an average fan.
customer_reviews.author: Guv'nor the English Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, with the right expectations
customer_reviews.text: The install is easy, though it sticks out from the wall more than I'd like. It does a good job of cooling the two rooms (about 950sq ft) that I have it for. Not loud. Other units I've seen/used in the same price and BTU had an added feature of being a heater too, which is why I feel the value to cost ratio is off. Overall, a good buy IF you understand the limitations of a standing portal unit verses the window units.
customer_reviews.author: Jynexia

customer_reviews.title: pretty easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Not too loud, pretty easy to set up, works quickly. The hardest part is the hot and cold lines, they are difficult to set up and not easy to move around. Comes with great storage protector. If you run it most of the day, it lasts about a week before you need to dump out the water.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased about a month ago and the unit work great! Unit located in living room (Coldest area as you would expect, 17x14), next to it is our dinning room (nicely cold, 12x12) which open up to kitchen area (remove the heat, it is comfortable area, 11x10). We keep the unit at 72C and our thermostat located between LR and DR read 72C.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio J Mangual

customer_reviews.title: A Great Covid Stimulus Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This big boy was delivered on it's top. The packaging was superb, and I couldn't be happier with this well designed/made unit.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Murtz

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love this it's definitely powerful, it's cold the closer you get to the unit, it doesn't move the air around alot, so I recommend a fan for air rotation.
customer_reviews.author: RedGameMaster420

customer_reviews.title: Best ac yet!
customer_reviews.text: Our room gets hot in the summer being upstairs. This a/c unit is amazing. So cold! It can cool off both bedrooms on a 95° day in the st.louis humidity. Had the unit running from may- September. great buy
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Anania

customer_reviews.title: To loud
customer_reviews.text: Air conditioning was very loud unable to sleep. The air condition puts out a lot of cold air And does a great job but unfortunately it is to loud for a bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Fredjoo

customer_reviews.title: This machine is AWESOME. Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This machine is AWESOME. Easy to set up; I did it myself. Cools 400 plus square feet with high ceilings on the second floor above the garage very well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Product proforms better than most 14000 btu units
customer_reviews.text: Product proforms better than most 14000 btu units, cost is well with the cooling power. I tested output at 42 deg nonstop.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Dual duct is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Dual duct is the way to go. No negative pressure in your house, and it cools like a real air conditioner!
customer_reviews.author: Albert Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Barely cools
customer_reviews.text: The 14000 BTU unit Cools so poorly that I now don't use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frequent Circuit breakage
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about it except circuit. It’s keeps breaking the fuse. I’m not sure if it’s a problem in my house or is it just too strong/ incompatible.
customer_reviews.author: CBG

customer_reviews.title: Great unit with multiple configurations!!
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these for remote server rooms, and they work great. You can choose single or dual hose installation depending on your usage. One of the units arrived without the accessories, and Whynter support sent them to us. They were great to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Amir Radfar

customer_reviews.title: Worked so well that I bought another one! Being ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked so well that I bought another one! Being able to wheel it around makes this a no brainer for me. It cools the rooms while sun hitting it without any issues. The disadvantage is it collects humidify/water in the basin Soyinka have to figure out a way to empty it every few days. I have a small step stool right night to it so I just life on top and unscrew rubber closer so water drips into a bowl. Process takes 5 minutes. I would rather deal with this than trying to fit the unit in the window and making sure it doesn't fall or bang up the windows...
customer_reviews.author: SuperDad

customer_reviews.title: Great air-conditioner for cooling!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my new air-conditioner!! It was easy to install, easy to use and works perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: Alessandra Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I anticipated. Cools our upstairs living room of about 600 square feet. Easy to setup and install.
customer_reviews.author: shebacon

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: not a bad unit lets see if it still works after the winter
customer_reviews.author: William R. Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Un fortunately there's a lag time between when AC is required
customer_reviews.text: another life saver. live in Chicago loop where building controls heat for winter and a/c for summer. Un fortunately there's a lag time between when AC is required. Again this has helped tremendously
customer_reviews.author: Mrwildbill

customer_reviews.title: Whynter ARC-143MX
customer_reviews.text: Makes a large area more comfortable, but not as much as I thought it would. Is noisier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: MARY

customer_reviews.title: Compressor Warranty = Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 years. Year 3 had issues on and off and the Compressor died the same week the warranty on it expired. Just know to expect it.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: Works well a little loud but pushes a lot of air
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ellis

customer_reviews.title: 1 Month Later it's Dead. Never had an appliance just die before.
customer_reviews.text: After 1 month the entire unit has died and is no longer functional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. Gets the room cold really fast. Dual hose so it makes sense it discards the hot air. It's a little bigger than I wanted it to be but it's well worth it. If you want the whole room to stay cold, this is it
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't cool off the whole area, and runs all the time thinking of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: gummybears17

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, so I guess I mostly like them.
customer_reviews.text: An attractive design but doesn't seem to get as cold as split ACs I have had. Don't count on it cooling anything more than a medium size (100-200 sf) room. Also: a little noisy. More padding inside might have quieted it down. Additional $25 over prime membership for FedEx shipping seems entirely reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Videokondriac

customer_reviews.title: Unit came with few minor marks unfortunately. Works decent ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit came with few minor marks unfortunately. Works decent. Pros: Gets cold Comes with dual hoses Cons: Fan weak at blowing air out into room Remote is not responsive as I would like(hit same button multiple times facing it different angles at times) Window kit does not fit my window but may fit yours Price GREATLY varies on this item so be careful when you chose to buy it, I was not careful.
customer_reviews.author: brett

customer_reviews.title: I bought this last year to use for the summer ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year to use for the summer, filled my massive living room. Finally regained control of my house! Customer service was exceptional if there was ever a problem. Will definitely purchase another one in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Berland

customer_reviews.title: Look no further for a portable AC
customer_reviews.text: This is quieter than some other portable AC units I have owned, it doesn't have a water drawer that must be emptied. The two tubes means it can cool down a larger area and I have found this to be true. We are able to keep the front area of our house (3 big rooms) comfortable, not cold, but comfortable. I bet if you put this is a smaller area, closer to what it's rated for, that you could make the room cold. It was very easy to setup and once summer is over we will store in a closet until next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Greer

customer_reviews.title: It is very good quality and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item yesterday and was delivered very quickly. It is very good quality and very quiet, unlike other air conditioning units I've owned. I am very satisfied and strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: bella

customer_reviews.title: Seem pretty weak go 14k
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, it's in a 150 square room and barely keeps the room at 80 degrees when it's mid 90s outside. Seem pretty weak go 14k btu
customer_reviews.author: Morgan A. Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Constantly have to plug it in and unplug it just ...
customer_reviews.text: Constantly have to plug it in and unplug it just to get it to even run. I have only used it twice. Never seems to want to run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... had other portable air conditioners that work well and cool down a small room
customer_reviews.text: I've had other portable air conditioners that work well and cool down a small room. This one does not. It is too heavy and awkward to repackage and return so I'm keeping it even though it is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: not as powerful as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: This unit is heavy. I had expected that a unit rated at 14,000 BYU would be a super cooler. Not so much. For the size, it is unable to cope with temps over 90 degrees. I would recommend a smaller unit with a better fan and a continuous operation function.
customer_reviews.author: brunhilda

customer_reviews.title: Not a good cooler, may cool a small bathroom if you ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a good cooler, may cool a small bathroom if you have all day to let it run, uses a lot of electricity to try and cool. 12,000 btu is one tone in a/c terms this would be considered to be a tone and a half. to cool approx. a 500sqft room. Not even
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best solution when central air is not an option
customer_reviews.text: After deciding to replaxe our window box conditioners Consumer Reports strongly recommended this brand. The ease of intallation can't be overstated compared to balancing heavy units on the sill and them carrying them off to storage in the winter. One unit was enough to cool our entire first floor and another the master bedroom on the second floor. The only issue is finding a plac to roll them for winter storage. One very humid week one unit developed comdensation in the window vents which shut it down, but eas easy to empty Can't be beat for efficiency,ease of installation and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. The one problem that I am having is that I will put a specific temperature on it, and it will not get to the temperature that I want in the room. I assume that is to humidity, but it's annoying to come into a room you are expecting it to be one temperature and it's higher than what you expected. It does however keep the room cool, just not to temp expectations. I also thought that this would have an auto function for fan speed adjustment. It doesn't. You have to choose your fan speed and it stays on whatever you choose.
customer_reviews.author: K O

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I researched and compared 14k BTU portables for weeks before making this purchase, and I'm glad I did. This is literally the perfect item. I use it in a 25'x14.5' space that has 4 aquariums and their lighting systems in there, producing a lot o heat, and humidity. The a/c's evaporative dehumidifier that functions while the a/c is on is amazing. In a 50-60% humid environment, this device has not had to be emptied at all yet, with 3 weeks of nearly continuous use. I only use the exhaust hose, and pull intake air from the same room, it works great. Really pleased with the unit, a lot of that has to do with realistic expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to buy another one for a room upstairs
customer_reviews.text: Cools one room very well, I use fans to blow the air to adjacent rooms of the bottom floor of our house. If it has an energy saver mode, one thing I wish it would do is shut down the blower (and thus the whole unit) - instead it just stops the chiller when reaching the temperature you set. Otherwise, its quiet, clean, and has helped us endure a very hot Michigan summer for a 1100 sq foot home with no central air. I'd like to buy another one for a room upstairs. Also, since it uses a standard refrigerant I can buy at the local stores, I'm hoping I can recharge it, when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Louder than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I let the unit sat fully upright for a full 24hrs before plug it in and it works marginally. On the first run starting at 11:00PM in my 500SF room at 83F by about 5:00AM in the morning room temperature dropped to 73F and stayed at that. The one thing that it bugs me the most is that specifications say this thing produces 56dcb (or 58dcb??) of noise but when I used a calibrated decibel meter to measure it showed that this unit screams a solid 68dcb across the board regardless of fan speed. Also the fan just starts to produce some kind of rattling noise. This is only my second day trial testing it so we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: I use this for my laser cutter
customer_reviews.text: In Arizona, its hot. So I have to add extra cooling ability to my laser cutter to protect the tube from cracking. Even though I have an industrial chiller for my laser, it was heating up too fast. I aim this air conditioner at the water chiller, and even on the hottest days Arizona can throw at me, this AC unit keeps the laser humming right along. It's a life saver for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Werden Replica Props

customer_reviews.title: best portable ac in the market
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I purchased this AC I had to have an indoor one because I have metal gates on my windows for security so I always said you get what you pay, also the dual exaust is the way to go I have a 500 square foot studio apt. and this ac does it no problem I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Shannon V.

customer_reviews.title: Cools quickly and keeps it cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old window air conditioner. I use it in the living room and keep ceiling fans going to circulate the air. This way most of my main floor (800 sq. ft.) stays cool. Since lugging a heavy window air conditioner into place every summer was starting to prove more difficult as I get older, I was looking for an easier solution. So far I am quite happy with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Scott

customer_reviews.title: This air conditioner was a life saver, in fact ...
customer_reviews.text: This air conditioner was a life saver, in fact we have 2 of these. One upstairs and one down. cools our whole house for the most part. 2000 SQ ft house.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works hard, occasionally trips the breaker.
customer_reviews.text: It blows the 15 amp breaker that it is plugged in to. It's pulling 11 amps itself I am going to have to add a dedicated plug and breaker just for the AC. Jury is out. I hope it lasts a long time. It's not overly loud.
customer_reviews.author: Crossroads Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud - Inefficient
customer_reviews.text: The unit was extremely loud. We wrapped a band around it to quiet the noise, still loud. The unit did not cool down the area (a small 720 ft. cottage). Our window air-conditioner did a better job by itself. We returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Redinger

customer_reviews.title: Super heavy and breaks easily. Good luck storing it.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this, but after trying to remove the hose- the plastic broke on the body and it weighs as much as a grown man. Let’s just say this thing is going in the trash. Should have bought it at costco - because they would have at least let us return it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thompson

customer_reviews.title: ... unit that just didn't seem to get the space cool enough. This unit has been keeping my room ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to replace a similar unit that just didn't seem to get the space cool enough. This unit has been keeping my room cool ever since and does an amazing job at it. It does not take up much space and is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Christian K.

customer_reviews.title: Will always use this kind/brand of air conditioner !
customer_reviews.text: This machine works great! This replaces one I had for years, so it is the third one I have bought. The first one is still working just fine. I will continue to replace, when needed, with the same kind.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Best portable AC unit out there
customer_reviews.text: This Unit is awesome. It has dual hoses which works much better. Single hose AC units cause a vacuum and pull in air through all the cracks in your house. This one equalizes the pressure by bringing in air from outside. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C.m. Craddock

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this a/c unit cools well over 500 square feet' I plan to buy one more.(THANKS AMAZON) My home is 1900 square feet this( WHYNTER 14000 BTU THAT I PURCHASEED AT AMAZON )KEEPS IT COOL'I PLAN TO PURCHASE ONE MORE 'BEFORE NEXT SPRING'I KNOW THAT WILL KEEP THOSE 1900 SQUARE FEET COLD.I'AM SURE IT'S GOING TO HELP MY POWER BILL A WHOLE LOT.NOW I DON'T HAVE TO USE THAT 5 TON UNIT EVERY DAY'THANKS AGAIN....AMAZON....
customer_reviews.author: wilbert  seymore

customer_reviews.title: it's cold
customer_reviews.text: It's cold. dual vents is where it's at. expensive tho. but still keeping 300 square feet cool
customer_reviews.author: Angeleno

customer_reviews.title: $500 Mistake
customer_reviews.text: This was a terrible mistake. It is very noisy. I have to turn up the volume on my tv or music quite a bit. I doesn't cool well. Sometimes the outside tempurature is lower than inside. There are other reviews that say the same things. They were absolutely right. I should have remembered that if several reviews give a bad review about the same issues, it's the product, not the reviewers. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: GW Erskine

customer_reviews.title: only attempting to cool living room and kitchen (rest of house closed off)
customer_reviews.text: decent but not strong enough for local cooling when placed in the kitchen on a triple-digit (F) day in a 3bd home. only attempting to cool living room and kitchen (rest of house closed off).
customer_reviews.author: butabara

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool just wish it cooled the rest of my apartment down but can really feel a difference . . If I had a complaint it's that you have to be careful moving it because it does leak water from the condensation. Real complaint I should have bought two ha
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: It cools better that the toshiba and delonghi units
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many portable air units. One toshiba water aided, delonghi water aided and a delonghi split unit. The water units tends to form buildup that is hard to clean. Ultimately it is this buildup that makes the machine stop working. (unless you want to open the unit up and scrape the contacts ( which was exciting at first but lost it luster after it became a weekly chore) I would avoid these the water units. The delonghi split unit work well with the exception of hauling on of the unit out doors.The Whynter unit has removed the water buildup chore and the lugging chore as well. It cools better that the toshiba and delonghi units.
customer_reviews.author: VH

customer_reviews.title: The ac cools pretty good. Will not cool the square footage that ...
customer_reviews.text: The ac cools pretty good. Will not cool the square footage that is stated. The biggest thing I do not like about the unit is the blower fan runs all the time.
customer_reviews.author: JM Stryker

customer_reviews.title: A great option if you don't want to install a full ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so helpful on those hot days. A great option if you don't want to install a full house AC.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Berry

customer_reviews.title: Better then I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this A/C for less then a week, however so far I have had no problems. I have one thing I don't like about it, the controls are not user friendly, the on off button is the smallest and the arrangement of the other controls are not in the right places that u normally think. It looks good and is not as loud I was expecting, at low speed it is not loud at all.
customer_reviews.author: Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little device! It's a workhorse, and does what it should.
customer_reviews.author: M_Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this AC
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this AC. I have 700sq feet with West facing full afternoon sunshine and it keeps the place 15 degrees cooler than outside.
customer_reviews.author: T. Truttmann

customer_reviews.title: Cool air, for small area. Very, very loud. Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Cool air and works in a relatively small area. We have two floors decided to put it downstairs by our TV. The unit is very, very loud and much bigger than I thought. Louder than a window unit!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: It cools great but the noise could be used for prison torture
customer_reviews.text: Had it running at 69 for about a month and a half straight- have only emptied it once so far. It cools great but the noise could be used for prison torture.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive to run; does not cool stated square footage.
customer_reviews.text: This A/C was totally ineffective in my home. It pulls a lot of amps and could only be put in certain areas due to the power requirement. If you are considering this for cost savings - DON'T. It is horribly expensive, If it is the only kind you can use, I suggest you go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ivey

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something contemporary, however the design is awful as it has a glaring led panel in front which needs to be covered at night, the drainage is located on the bottom in the back which is difficult, and it is noisy.....
customer_reviews.author: Debra Damari.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It will not cool the square footage claimed, expect about half.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Santa

customer_reviews.title: Clumsy!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize that using this air conditioner would be so cumbersome! It is almost impossible to empty the water reservoir. I would definitely not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: D Nelson

product_meta.title: Whynter ARC-143MX 14,000 BTU Dual Hose 3-in-1 Portable Air Conditioner with 3M Antimicrobial Filter and Storage Bag, Up to to 500 sq ft
product_meta.description: Designed with specialized commercial applications in mind, the ARC-13MX is ideal for use in server rooms, data centers, wiring closets or any space where high efficiency cooling and low maintenance is a requirement. The unit helps to maintain optimal operating conditions by cooling, dehumidifying and filtering the ambient air.
feature_bullets: 14,000 btu cooling, dual hose operation, cfc free r-410a refrigerant and lead free rohs compliant components
Patented auto-drain function fully exhausts all condensate automatically in most environments. Power supply: 115 V / 60Hz / 1 Phase
Three operational modes: Air conditioner, fan or dehumidifier. Noise level (dBA): less than 56

Includes extendable exhaust and intake hoses (up to 60") and window kit (up to 46"). Full thermostatic control (61°F – 89°F). Dehumidifying Capacity- 91 Pts / day. Air Flow (at high speed): 384 m3/h / 226 CFM
Remote control, upgraded plastic window kit (46" max.), carbon air filter and washable pre-filter included. Max. window kit length = 46" , Min. window kit length = 20"

specifications.Warranty Description: One year limited warranty & three year warranty on compressor.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars202 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
